DOC.HEAD: Explosions Kill Child, Rock Red Cross Office
DOC.TEXT: Grenades exploded at the Red Cross headquarters in this capital and at an interior town, killing a child and injuring a man, the fire department said Thursday. Five-year-old Elisa Chiquin Tax died from injuries suffered in the explosion Wednesday in Santa Cruz del Quiche, 100 miles northeast of Guatemala City. In that blast, an unidentified adult also was injured, authorities said. Police said they had no clue who was responsible for either explosion. Guatemala endured a rash of violence this year in which explosions downed power lines and killed several people in business districts and riding public transportation.
